page.title: 01ASTON-JUXTA-MONDRUM
page.content: This area is situated in between two villages,{Church Minshull}in the North and{Worleston}in the South. Aston-juxta-Mondrum means the place next to the forest. This forest has long since gone; all that remains is {Delamere Forest}east of Chester. The inhabitants centre on either of the two villages mentioned or{Minshull {Vernon}in the East. Some people shop in the relatively new town of{Crewe}, but the farming community use{Nantwich an older market town.Approximately 15 large farms use the area for{dairy- {farming.}Apart from these large old houses there are a few farm cottages and some old and modern private houses The{Shropshire Union Canal}and the {River Weaver}cross the area and there is a{sewage works}in the South.
